items.content_html:
【午後聊聊艾多美】青蘋果瘦身果凍

🤩 小小一條青蘋果果凍是個寶呢！每日兩條，餐前享用 😋 🍏 多酚可以有效抗氧化抗衰老，亦有效抑制體內脂肪的累積。 🍏 而蘋果中富含多酚量，但不是每個蘋果都一樣的呢。 🍏 青蘋果的多酚量比普通熟紅蘋果要多出 10 倍多酚量。 🍏 艾多美青蘋果瘦身果凍就是採用優質精選青蘋果。 🍏 天然萃取，採用個別認證原料，不添加任何防腐劑人工香料。 🎥 去片了解青蘋果瘦身果凍： youtu.be/f5YRfP7m3…

items.title: 聽課不止聽一次
items.content_html:
近年我學習的一個主要渠道是 Coursera、edX、YouTube、Atomy Ch。一方面，我會利用人工智能讀取字幕，整理出片段的總結說明文字。另一方面，遇上重要的學習短片，我必定會下載至電話，一而再、再而三的反覆觀看。

  1. 第一次聽，我聽到的是新認知。此時腦海中新的神經元連線粗略形成，但未結實。
  2. 第二次聽，我開始聽明白表面意思，神經元的連接變得紮實，亦有機會與過往的經驗及其他知識點關聯起來。
  3. 第三次聽，可以驗證剛剛建立的聯繫是否有效。
  4. 第四次聽，開始更深層的領略字裏行間的意思，包括會對每個詞語及每個數字有更深刻的參透，及沒有寫出來的文字間的意思。
  5. 第五次聽，可以再挖深，並開始能舉一反三。悟出箇中玄機。

items.content_html:
我們的記憶是由腦中的神經元和它們之間的連接構成。當我們學習或體驗某件事時，相關的神經元會被激活、連接，就是我稱為的烙印。這些神經元連接組合起來的「記憶痕跡」，慢慢地形成一個個烙印沙丘，再隨著重覆使用與激活這些神經元，沙丘慢慢結實，形式島嶼。

這些島嶼之間的關連連接橋越多，入口就越充足，思考時能回想起這段記憶的機會就越大。而每次重新回憶及使用這些連接時，這個島嶼的地基就會越穩固，亦有可能形式新的連接橋。

而當兩個看似沒關係的神經元烙印島嶼連接起來時，新的洞察力（Insight）就因而形成。

items.title: 捉緊快閃靈感的方法：寫下神經元烙印的入口
items.content_html:
我們的思念、想法、靈感，往往會在腦海中飛快閃過。如果可以捉緊這念頭，往往會擴展出一段新想法、新構想、或與現有的想法連結起新的神經元通訊通道。

問題是，怎樣捉緊這些快閃思念。我會用紙筆、或長開的 iPad、或長開的手寫 eInk 電子紙。然後在閃過思念時極速寫下關於這念頭的一兩個關鍵字。又或者在街外時，馬上拿起 To-Do 軟件，將最重要的關鍵字打上。

這樣，就算馬上有別的事情要做，只要這個關鍵字在，忘碌完再回來處理時，就可以順藤摸瓜，從這個入口，重新激活起剛剛在腦內神經元之間閃過的微弱痕跡，剛才的靈感便會重新浮現出來。

所以我捉緊快閃靈感的方法是留下入口，否則，門都沒有。

items.content_html:
每逢我拿著書，遇到朋友時，就會比較容易打開平時不太會談的話題。通常朋友會好奇我在看甚麼書，然後話題便會圍繞著書本標題而展開。

如果是愛書之人，話題就會變成書中的內容，以及引伸至大家閱讀過的其他書籍，進行廣泛的討論。

如果不是愛書之人，我就會把書的內容引申到生活中的點滴，轉變成生活化的討論。

items.content_html:
我習慣使用To-Do來撰寫快速筆記，原因有以下：

一， To-Do是其中一個最常開的軟件，所以是最容易存取到的軟件，也是很可能一直長開而存在於記憶體中沒有關掉的軟件。符合快速記錄所需要的快速打開。

二，快速記錄即是正在等待琢磨的原材料，所以本身也是一個To-Do Task，文字等待被進一步擴展，然後放到輸出的位置。所以存放於待辦事項中也是合理。

items.content_html: 游完水。以往我一年又不到一次水，雖然我好鍾意在水中游，但我從來都不喜歡游水前後換衫抹身環節。所以每年都無甚意欲就去游水。但今年起兩小兒開始習泳，一星期一至兩堂，我也順便陳教練帶他們的時候，自己也順便練習，練習更舒服更長久的蛙式游法。另外，由細到大都看不懂蝶泳。

items.content_html: 十月世界技能競賽（WorldSkills）的 IT 範野項目在南韓舉行。找了整天如何澳門飛南韓，發現沒有同一航空公司可以由澳門飛往南韓的。若台北轉機會超出 12 小時內須轉機限制。新加玻要用不同航空公司。香港飛去可以用回港易然後直飛南韓，但回來香港不能直接轉回澳門，應要在香港隔黎。

items.content_html:
Resilient Web Design—Chapter 5

Some designers have misunderstood progressive enhancement to mean that all functionality must be provided to everyone. It’s the opposite. Progressive enhancement means providing core functionality to everyone. After that, it’s every browser for itself.

items.title: To Explore Chunk-size Knowledge For My Teaching Material Creation
items.content_html: What if I make every bit of information for my teaching lessons into chunk-size knowledge. It both benefits the creators and the audiences. I can create them without much stress every day. And my audiences can digest them easier. By grouping the 1 minute videos and description text together, the chunks are then grouped into series and collections as a whole course.

items.content_html:
Reading Profit First, on doing one thing well.

Your time is valuable. You can make more money by focusing on one thing and doing it well, instead of trying to do many things, none of them well.
items.content_text:
Reading Profit First, on doing one thing well. 

> Your time is valuable. You can make more money by focusing on one thing and doing it well, instead of trying to do many things, none of them well.

items.content_html:
Reading Profit First

The easiest way to increase profit is to cut expenses, not sell more. Take a look at all your yearly expenses and cut them by 10 percent. Cancel everything you don’t need to run efficiently and keep your customers happy. Then negotiate every remaining expense, except payroll.
items.content_text:
Reading Profit First

> The easiest way to increase profit is to cut expenses, not sell more. Take a look at all your yearly expenses and cut them by 10 percent. Cancel everything you don’t need to run efficiently and keep your customers happy. Then negotiate every remaining expense, except payroll.

items.content_html:
Reading Profit First.

The first step is to use the new accounting formula, sales minus profit equals expense.
items.content_text:
Reading Profit First. 

> The first step is to use the new accounting formula, sales minus profit equals expense.

items.content_html:
Reading Profit First.

One of the biggest flaws of traditional accounting (sales minus expenses equals profit) is that it only focuses on the first two, and the profit is ignored. This is where the Profit First system comes in.

items.title: Reading: Difference between 50M vs 25M vs 16M bitrates
items.content_html:
www.dpreview.com/forums/th…

If you are shooting a static subject with no fine detail, the smaller bit rate is probably enough to capture all the information, and there is no visible difference between the bit rates.

Bit rate setting typically specifies the upper limit for the actual bit rate. In case of static subject, the actual bit rate can be than the maximum bit rate. Try shooting for example foliage when there is some wind. You should start seeing differences in the image quality and probably also in the file size.
items.content_text:
[www.dpreview.com/forums/th...](https://www.dpreview.com/forums/thread/4464512#forum-post-63602620)

> If you are shooting a static subject with no fine detail, the smaller bit rate is probably enough to capture all the information, and there is no visible difference between the bit rates.

> Bit rate setting typically specifies the upper limit for the actual bit rate. In case of static subject, the actual bit rate can be than the maximum bit rate. Try shooting for example foliage when there is some wind. You should start seeing differences in the image quality and probably also in the file size.

items.title: Downgrade again
The fault of vpet-whkc2017
items.content_html:
2017 年，做個網站全版幾乎空白，淨係得個 Flash，然後寥寥幾行內容，用到各自四層 Bootstrap div 裝住。再加圖片完全唔落 alt （即係瀏覽器理解為裝飾性，非內容，內容處理上直接無視幅圖）。

然後？然後就係用 media query 刻意係大屏幕隱藏咗最必要（所有）既內容。做多咗，仲衰咗。Man, this is 2017, not 1997.

我成日同學生講，瀏覽器天生好勁，你唔好亂加 tag 亂套 css，做好最基本幾個 structure tag。其實所有內容都係唔同機種（包括讀音機）有條不紊咁呈現出黎。基礎寫好咗，你想點花巧都得。基礎完全零，Oh man，重做唔該。

items.title: Listening to the Hitchhiker’s Guide to the Galaxy
How I am using Automatic Check-in in Basecamp
items.content_html:
I like to collect thoughts. These thoughts may not be useful at the moment. I write them down so some day later, these random thoughts may connect to each other to create a full circle of idea.

I used to use Docs and Files to collect these kind of input. The files, however, get messy and difficult to organized when the files count grows. And since most of the input are so random, actually I don’t have specific file that I should look into when I am looking for inspiration thought my past mind.

Having all the daily random thoughts separated in Docs & Files and Folders make accessing them and reading them difficult, until I found that Audomatic Checkin fit this usage.

“It creates a timeline of my mind. ”
The Autmatic Check-in is like a feed of information ordered by date. So every day, when I type, I put the text input into this “feed”. And when I review my previous ideas, Ivan just scroll and read my mind from the latest date to the very early date. It creates a timeline of my mind.

What is diary. What is thought log
items.content_html:
What is diary. What is thought log?

JunkDraft is a place to write down thoughts and inputs and so these text and information later constructs and composes into piece of output.

Diary, on the other hand, is the life log of what special happened that day. And what happened here will stay and won’t transform into output directly. (It may although become passive ideas in the mind and so generate new ideas based on the experience)
items.content_text:
What is diary. What is thought log?

JunkDraft is a place to write down thoughts and inputs and so these text and information later constructs and composes into piece of output.

Diary, on the other hand, is the life log of what special happened that day. And what happened here will stay and won't transform into output directly. (It may although become passive ideas in the mind and so generate new ideas based on the experience)

Haven’t use the Pomodoro technique this morning. And it turned out to be a highly distracted morning.

So when I have multiple computers and multiple screens at work, having a focus goal makes the extra screen serves well. But if I don’t have any goal, the extra screens are all just distractions.

Quote from WHATWG.

html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage…

The WHATWG was based on several core principles, in particular that technologies need to be backwards compatible, that specifications and implementations need to match even if this means changing the specification rather than the implementations, and that specifications need to be detailed enough that implementations can achieve complete interoperability without reverse-engineering each other.

Quote from WHATWG. [html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage...](https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/introduction.html#history-2)
The WHATWG was based on several core principles, in particular that technologies need to be backwards compatible, that specifications and implementations need to match even if this means changing the specification rather than the implementations, and that specifications need to be detailed enough that implementations can achieve complete interoperability without reverse-engineering each other.

items.content_html:
Reading: CSS Link in body.

You need to take care when using layout systems where content dictates layout (such as tables & flexbox) to avoid content-shifting during load. This isn't a new problem, but progressive rendering can expose it more frequently. You can hack flexbox to behave, but CSS grid is a much better system for overall page layout (flexbox is still great for smaller components).
items.content_text:
Reading: CSS Link in body.

You need to take care when using layout systems where content dictates layout (such as tables & flexbox) to avoid content-shifting during load. This isn't a new problem, but progressive rendering can expose it more frequently. You can hack flexbox to behave, but CSS grid is a much better system for overall page layout (flexbox is still great for smaller components).
